artefact: School special educational needs (SEN) approval (Northern Ireland)

artefact.overview: You need approval by the Department for Education in Northern Ireland to cater for special education in a non-maintained school
artefact.licence_short_description: Approval by the Department for Education in Northern Ireland to cater for special education in a non-maintained school.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you are a non-maintained school that caters for special educational needs, you must be approved by the [Department of Education.](http://www.deni.gov.uk/ "Department of Education"){:rel="external"}

A child will be deemed to have special educational needs if he or she has a learning difficulty that requires special education to be provided for him or her.

The Department of Education must consent for any child to be educated at your premises.

Your school must specialise in providing education for children with special educational needs.

details.description: Help with school costs, the curriculum and school attendance
Get help if you're at school, planning to go on to further or higher education, looking for training or interested in a student or career development loan.
